thread.title: Think Leslie Jones Can't Play Donald Trump? You're Wrong, Bigly.
thread.title_full: Think Leslie Jones Can't Play Donald Trump? You're Wrong, Bigly.

author: Carla Herreria
title: Think Leslie Jones Can't Play Donald Trump? You're Wrong, Bigly.
text:
Think Leslie Jones Can't Play Donald Trump? You're Wrong, Bigly. “It’s about giving America what it wants.” 02/12/2017 02:07 am ET Carla   
When the world got a taste of Melissa McCarthy as White House press secretary Sean Spicer and Rosie O’Donnell floated a Steve Bannon-infused profile picture , the internet demanded an all-female cast to play   on “Saturday Night Live.” 
But the internet probably didn’t expect a Leslie Jones masterpiece. 
“I never dreamed I could play the president,” Jones says during a behind-the-scenes style skit that aired Saturday night. “But then Melissa played Spicer and I was like, ‘Yo, why can’t I play Trump?’” That moment when you've finally found your calling. @Lesdoggg #SNL pic.twitter.com/Y7Unmw5NVV   
As seen in the video above, Jones trained with determination to be the next orange-glazed POTUS ― golden toupee, eyebrows and all. 
The impersonation, Jones warns her cast mates, is not a jab at Trump’s “fragile masculinity” and it isn’t a commentary on race and politics. 
Jones says with certainty: “It’s about giving America what it wants.” 
Things, however, don’t turn out as planned. Just a professional disagreement between Lorne and @Lesdoggg about whether she should play Trump on #SNL . pic.twitter.com/yZFyqFTfip   
Trump has dutifully expressed his loathing for “SNL,” especially since they’ve doubled down on POTUS since he took office, but reports this week revealed that he may have been most peeved that McCarthy, a woman, played Spicer on last week’s episode. 
Now, with Jones attempting her own version of the Donald, the world awaits a reaction from the Commander in Chief. . @Lesdoggg just took one for the team. She portrayed Trump on @SNL tonight so he gotta fire himself twice now. pic.twitter.com/2uT9nlEU1T — Matthew A. Cherry (@MatthewACherry) February 12, 2017 Remember how Trump got mad that Melissa McCarthy played Sean Spicer on #SNL ? Allow me to introduce you to LESLIE JONES AS TRUMP. pic.twitter.com/x3f1V3r6o0 — Caroline O. (@RVAwonk) February 12, 2017 . @realDonaldTrump might resign after watching Leslie Jones as Trump on #SNL 😂
